text: Charles F. Nelan (April 10, 1859 – December 7, 1904) was an American artist and political cartoonist, known for his cartoons on the Spanish–American War, some 135 of which appeared in the New York Herald. His work in the Philadelphia North American was often critical of Samuel Pennypacker and Matthew Quay. Nelan's work also helped solidify the image of Uncle Sam as a personification of the United States. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1859 births Category:1904 deaths Category:American editorial cartoonists Category:American illustrators Category:Artists from Akron, Ohio
title: Charles Nelan
